dt: {bc}to make (someone, such as oneself) amenable to the discipline and control of a superior
{bc}to cause or force to undergo or endure (something unpleasant, inconvenient, or trying)

shortdef: to bring under control or dominion : subjugate
to make (someone, such as oneself) amenable to the discipline and control of a superior

dt.t: The firm is {it}subject to{/it} state law.
The schedule is tentative and {phrase}subject to change{/phrase}.
Clothing purchases over $200 are {it}subject to{/it} tax.
Anyone caught trespassing is {it}subject to{/it} a $500 fine.

dt: {bc}likely to do, have, or suffer from (something)

dt.t: My cousin is {it}subject to{/it} panic attacks.
I'd rather not live in an area that is {it}subject to{/it} flooding.

dt: {bc}dependent on something else to happen or be true

dt.t: The sale of the property is {it}subject to{/it} approval by the city council.
All rooms are just $100 a night, {it}subject to{/it} availability.

shortdef: affected by or possibly affected by (something)
likely to do, have, or suffer from (something)
dependent on something else to happen or be true
